alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 10:43AM PST until March 08 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 1 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches is possible for eastern shores of Lake Tahoe. Western Lake Tahoe communities could see 6-12 inches of new snow, while Sierra passes could see up to 14 inches through Wednesday afternoon. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 1 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. Very strong winds could cause tree damage. Periods of wind gusts up to 25-30 mph producing blowing and drifting snow may reduce visibilities on area roadways at times. Reduce speeds in low visibility.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
